Bruised.name: Bruised
Bruised.description:
Your survivor will likely take quite the beating out there in the zombie apocalypse, and bruises are a lasting reminder of their struggles. The most common way to get a bruise is to have your armor absorb all of the damage from an attack. Other common ways involve falling, tripping, or other environmental dangers. Finally, some zombies and large animals will more easily deal bruises with their special attacks.

  • Once the number of bruises you have is equal to or greater than your maximum Hit Points, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Fatigued]{Fatigued} and you cannot get rid of the condition until your number of bruises is less than you maximum Hit Points.
  • If the number of bruises is ever equal or greater to twice your maximum Hit Points you are also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 1} and you cannot recover from this condition until the total number of bruises is less than twice your maximum Hit Points.
  • Finally, if your number of bruises is ever equal to or greater than three times your maximum Hit Points, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Unconscious]{Unconscious} and cannot be roused until the total is less than that amount.

You can recover from bruises in several ways.

  • A successful use of @Compendium[hopefinder.actions.jIN7minzIXOY3YJk]{Treat Wounds} by someone trained in the Medicine skill heals 1 or more bruises.
  • A full night's rest heals a number of bruises equal to your Constitution (minimum 1). Add your level to this number if you are fully fed and hydrated. A full day's rest heals doubles this number (minimum 2).
  • @Compendium[hopefinder.equipment.QhQICRaozexpChof]{Aspirin} and Ice Packs heal 1 bruise and 1d4 bruises respectively after 10 minutes.
  • @Compendium[hopefinder.equipment.SV0M9dfS2dEOUQqP]{Beer} and @Compendium[hopefinder.equipment.gf43bT7SBtUvVPFn]{Liquor} heal 1 and 2 bruises respectively, but it counts against your Hydration.

Effect: Burning Branch.name: Effect: Burning Branch
Effect: Burning Branch.description: Attacks with the burning branch that hit deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.

Effect: Demand Results.name: Effect: Demand Results
Effect: Demand Results.description: Targets gain a +1 status bonus to attack and damage rolls.

Effect: Inspire.name: Effect: Inspire
Effect: Inspire.description: You gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

Effect: Insulted.name: Effect: Insulted
Effect: Insulted.description: The target becomes enraged and takes a -2 circumstance penalty when attacking anyone except you (-4 on a critical success).

1.label: Attacking the one who insulted you

Effect: Menace.name: Effect: Menace
Effect: Menace.description: The raider gets a +1 circumstance bonus on Intimidation checks made to demoralize for each other visible raider or road warrior in the area (maximum +4).

Effect: Rehearsed.name: Effect: Rehearsed
Effect: Rehearsed.description: You have learned how to clear you mind before undertaking an important task. Spend 10 minutes rehearsing, meditating, or otherwise preparing for a task. You get a +2 circumstance bonus on that task if you attempt the check within the next hour. You must name the task when you make your preparations. If you enter combat, this preparation is lost.

Effect: Vitamins.name: Effect: Vitamins
Effect: Vitamins.description: You gain a +2 bonus on Fortitude saves

Hope.name: Hope
Hope.description:
You can call upon your hope in the following ways.

  • After you roll a check, but before the results are revealed, you can call upon your Hope to reroll and take the higher result.
  • If you are hit in combat and the attack roll is a critical hit, you can call upon your Hope to treat the attack as a normal hit instead.
  • If you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Unconscious]{Unconscious} and dying, you can call upon your Hope to skip the dying check at the end of your turn. This does not reduce your dying value or stabilize you, and on your next turn you must check again as normal.
